intro: Hymenostemma pseudanthemis, commonly known as the false blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, blue-to-purple ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus Hymenostemma. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. The leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
